page.title: 16Framlinghan Town Council
page.content: We spoke to Miss Monica Tett who is the chairman of our Town Council. She told us that it has 15 members who do a variety of jobs(architects, company directors, housewives a milkman and teachers, like herself). When she goes somewhere officially representing the town she wears the official badge. On it are symbols: a wall for the castle, green for the grass, blue for the Mere,a lion for the Dukes of Norfolk crosses for the churches and a book for the schools. The Council owns the churchyard, the cemetery, Castle Meadow and Castle Pond, Pageant Field and the Market Hill. Income from the stalls on the Hill is used to supplement income by rates to pay for town services. The town is responsible for 52 footpaths and 2 bridle paths and some street lighting. The Town is linked with Coucy le Chateau.
